entry.tran: 杂乱的一堆；混乱的一团
entry.def: A jumble of things is a lot of different things that are all mixed together in a disorganized or confused way.

example.ex: The shoreline was made up of a jumble of huge boulders.
example.tran: 海岸线上堆着一大堆杂乱的巨石。
一连串毫无意义的胡言乱语

entry.def: If you jumble things or if things jumble, they become mixed together so that they are untidy or are not in the correct order.

example.ex: He's making a new film by jumbling together bits of his other movies...
example.tran: 他将自己的几部影片东一块西一块地拼凑成一部新电影。

example.ex: ...a number of animals whose remains were jumbled together by scavengers and floods...
example.tran: 被食腐动物丢弃又被洪水冲积在一起的一些动物残骸

entry.def: Jumble is old or unwanted things that people give away to charity.

example.ex: She expects me to drive round collecting jumble for the church.
example.tran: 她期望我能开车去四处收集旧物用于教堂义卖。

means.word_mean: 2. small flat ring-shaped cake or cookie
3. a theory or argument made up of miscellaneous or incongruous ideas
1. be all mixed up or jumbled together;

sentences.sentence: "She jumbles the words when she is supposed to write a sentence"

list.explanation: [黑人用语](思人称呼白人的绰号) 约翰牛

example.en: Get all you can out of the Jumbles.
example.zh: 你得尽一切可能离这些"约翰牛"远一点儿。

auth_sentence.content: All the dolls and toys were...all in a jumble.
auth_sentence.res_content: All the dolls and toys were...all in a jumble.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: All the dolls and toys were...all in a jumble.

sentences.en: He jumbled the pages in the paper.
sentences.cn: 他把纸张的顺序弄乱了。

sentences.en: Make sure you don’t jumble everything up.
sentences.cn: 一定不要把东西全都弄乱了。

sentences.en: The details of the accident were all jumbled together in his mind.
sentences.cn: 他把事故细节记得颠三倒四。
